newsitem.title: UK: NWE gas oil sharply weaker despite U.S. stock draw.
newsitem.headline: NWE gas oil sharply weaker despite U.S. stock draw.

text.p: NWE gas oil prices were sharply weaker on Wednesday after bearish U.S. crude and gasoline stock builds sent futures markets tumbling.

Traders said the API report for distillates was mildly bullish showing a 1.1 million barrel draw in U.S. stocks, but benchmark gas oil futures fell around $3 tugged lower by weaker crude and NYMEX gasoline futures.
Slack demand in Europe also put pressure on differentials to futures, adding a further 50 cents to $1 to overall losses.
In the key ARA market supportive buying interest from one major was less evident today adding to the dearth of demand.
Premiums for prompt lifting barges eased around 50 cents to June IPE +$1/$1.50 a tonne fob Rotterdam with sellers of early June liftings heard around June IPE $1.50 a tonne fob ARA.
EN590 barge and cargo premiums remained under pressure and were well offered at around June IPE +$12. Buyers were hard to find and notionally around $2 lower.
0.2 sulphur cargo differentials were also easier. Russian cargoes talked around June IPE +$2.50/$3.00 after 30kt traded into Hamburg around this level on Tuesday.
